page.title: 07RESCUE SERVICES IN ST.IVES.
page.content: St.Ives has 3 rescue services that are mainly manned by trained part-time volunteers. The{RNLI's}'Frank Penfold Marshall' is a 37 foot Oakley type self-righting lifeboat,with a crew of 8. It is launched from a trailer pulled by caterpillar tractor.The Inshore boat,a high speed inflatable, is used for rescues close to shore. The{Fire Service}has 18 part-time members under a Station Officer.It has two tenders and a Land Rover.The firemen are called out by siren and radio bleeper. The 17 Auxillary{Coastguards}have a full-time Sectore Officer in charge. Visual and radar watch is kept from the lookout on the Island.The cliff Rescue team patrols the coast in a fully equipped Land Rover.
